SENT.plain: A 15-year-old female adolescent with depression developed myoclonus after uninterrupted treatment with sertraline over 6 years
Withdrawal of sertraline and continuation of methylphenidate did not result in any improvement
Treatment with valproic acid resulted in improvement of the movement disorder
This report suggests that myoclonus may be a side effect of sertraline in some adolescents

Further, we hypothesized that extended treatment over several years, young age, and a compromised central nervous system due to underlying disorders may be risk factors for the development of this side effect
